description: I love being able to control my music from the terminal, how intuitive the controlls are and how little resources it uses.

This app sets out to do exactly as it says in the description, and executes well! It's a simple UI for your spotify needs, whilst having most functionality of the default client. The browse feature is nice, there is a search feature, but doesn't seem to work well for finding new music choices. Overall, I'm very satisfied and hope to see more updates and user customization options coming soon!

Easy to use overall and works great.
You can adjust volume or go back and forth in a song timeline. The only issue this app could give you is if you try to search for new music or playlists. I only used it for a few days, so maybe I am slow, but seemed a bit harder to do.
You can listen to your own playlists and saved songs easily, so I meant like searching ofr other's.

Cool interface and style, minimalist almost retro look. 
I really like the simplicity of it. 
Everything works well on Fedora 38. 
Only gripe is, no search. Well to be specific, there's no way to search the Spotify library (aside from your own library/saves). 
If that was a feature that was available, then I would give it 5 stars.
it works nice, plays all my music while being light. they need to add a fuction to search in the library though, it's really annoying to have to scroll to find everything.
It does what it says on the tin. When I discovered you can use your mouse as well, this client was the perfect replacement for background music.

I like that it is just a player of your existing albums, artists, playlists, podcast - instead of being a full-fledged player, song search, lyrics, etc.

However, a big blow is that it doesn't integrate with the system music manager (on Opensuse) meaning your play/pause buttons won't work. This is a big blow for me.
pls allow at least pasting the spotify password via ctrl-v, tyvm
THIS IS FANTASTIC. Actually WORKS. ive had the official client break on me so many times.
